x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement:
Hyperlocal Resource Inefficiency Crisis: Urban apartment complexes and dense neighborhoods suffer from massive resource duplication and waste. Key challenges include:
Duplicate Purchases: Residents buy identical items (pressure washers, party supplies, tools) that sit unused 95% of the time Storage Constraints: Limited apartment space forces people to discard functional items or avoid purchasing needed tools Social Disconnection: Neighbors live meters apart but never interact, missing opportunities for mutual support Economic Burden: Low-income residents can't access expensive tools/equipment, limiting home maintenance and quality of life Environmental Waste: Thousands of barely-used items per building complex end up in landfills annually

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Platform Components:

  1. Asset Management: Track shared items, usage schedules, condition monitoring, and maintenance needs across building complexes
  2. Service Portal: Resident-facing interface for browsing available items, booking reservations, and community interaction
  3. Workflow Engine: Automate booking approvals, pickup/return notifications, and conflict resolution processes
  4. Mobile App: Quick access for residents to check item availability, scan QR codes, and manage reservations
  5. Performance Analytics: Dashboard showing utilization rates, cost savings, environmental impact, and community engagement metrics
  6. Case Management: Handle item disputes, damage reports, and maintenance requests efficiently
  7. Virtual Agent: AI chatbot to help residents find items, answer usage questions, and facilitate neighbor connections
  8. Integration Hub: Connect with building management systems, payment processors, and smart lock technologies
  9. Knowledge Management: Community guidelines, item instructions, and neighbor skill-sharing database
